Module org.monarchinitiative.phenol.analysis
Package org.monarchinitiative.phenol.analysis.mgsa

Class MgsaScore

java.lang.Object
org.monarchinitiative.phenol.analysis.mgsa.MgsaScoreBase
org.monarchinitiative.phenol.analysis.mgsa.MgsaScore
Direct Known Subclasses:
FixedAlphaBetaScore
public abstract class MgsaScore extends MgsaScoreBase
Extends Bayes2GOScoreBase with p prior and the ability to count term activations.
Author:
Sebastian Bauer

    • MgsaScore

      public MgsaScore(Random rnd, int[][] termLinks, int numGenes, MgsaScore.IGeneValueProvider geneValueProvider)

    • MgsaScore

      public MgsaScore(Random rnd, int[][] termLinks, boolean[] observedGenes)
      Constructs a class for calculating the Bayes2GO score suitable for an MCMC algorithm.
      Parameters:
      rnd - Random source for proposing states.
      termLinks - terms to genes.
      observedGenes - state of each gene whether it is observed or not.

    • score

      public double score(int[] activeTerms)
      Returns the score of the setting if the given terms are active and all others are inactive.
      Parameters:
      activeTerms - defines which terms are considered as active
      Returns:
      the score

    • getScore

      public abstract double getScore()
      Returns:
      the score of the current state.

      Propose a new state.
      Parameters:

    • proposeNewState

      public void proposeNewState()

    • exchange

      public void exchange(int t1, int t2)
      Exchange the state from t1 to t2. This is merely a short-cut to switchState() being called on t1 and t2 in sequence. It does not check if the state is really exchanged.
      Parameters:
      t1 - id of the first term to be toggled
      t2 - id of the second term to be toggled

    • undoProposal

      public abstract void undoProposal()
      Undos the previous proposal.

    • getNeighborhoodSize

      public abstract long getNeighborhoodSize()
      Returns:
      the size of the current neighborhood, i.e., the number of states transitions that are possible from the current state.

    • record

      public void record()
      Records the current settings.

    • getActiveTerms

      public int[] getActiveTerms()
      Returns:
      the terms that are currently activated
